page.title: 12Local News, July 1985, BSE
page.content: In the "Bury Free Press", Friday 5th July 1985, the main article was on a campaign by a Liberal councillor for the withdrawal of hollow chocolate eggs containing small toys on which a child in Ireland choked to death. A local minister appealed at the funeral of an unknown baby for the parents to come forward. This story has been running for several weeks. Also on the front page was an account of a Bury father rescuing his two children from their blazing bedroom and a photograph and account of the retirement of the publicans of the Railway Hotel. Prominent on the inner pages was the celebration of Sir Eldon Griffiths' 21st year in Parliament. On the letters' page the two main topics were spiritualism and pre-school education.
